project.teaser: The TITAN project will demonstrate the latest transparency related solutions to help drive the formation of a demand-driven European economy predicted on the production and consumption of healthy, sustainable, and affordable food. Comprising 28 partners from 14 countries (10...
project.objective: The TITAN project will demonstrate the latest transparency related solutions to help drive the formation of a demand-driven European economy predicted on the production and consumption of healthy, sustainable, and affordable food. Comprising 28 partners from 14 countries (10 MS and 2 associated countries), TITAN will provide an extensive platform for the development of a wide range of innovations that aid transparency and address key challenges identified in the European Green Deal (EGD). With a broad mix of cutting-edge technology providers SMEs and start-ups, linked to leading research centres and agri-food stakeholders, TITAN, through dedicated business support together with a €1.25M open call, will provide a fertile breeding ground of ideas and solutions for businesses to thrive within the new strategy of the EGD. Through a co-creation approach, 15 innovative solutions including exploiting Blockchain, AI and IoT will be demonstrated in a first wave of TITAN transparency related innovations. These will be supplemented by a further wave of innovations on themes selected by stakeholders in an open call that will be open at the end of Year 1 of this four-year project. The new innovations will deliver transparency solutions in the areas of food safety and authenticity, traceability, health and sustainability and improving information to the consumer. The innovations will be supported by cross cutting WPs dedicated to transparency, ICT solutions, policy, business support, management and communication and dissemination. The project is led by industry facing, not-for-profit organisations with extensive outreach capabilities within Europe and beyond that will enhance the transferability and upscaling and impact of TITAN solutions and provide the building blocks of a demand-driven economy that provides healthy, sustainable, and accessible food for its citizens.
project.title: Transparency solutions for transforming the food system.
project.keywords: sustainability, health, blockchain, AI, IoT, data sharing, consumer behaviour

result.title: Practice Abstracts – batch 1
result.description: This deliverable contains the first 3 practice abstracts submitted to EIP-AGRI.

result.title: Plan for synergistic work of food safety pilots
result.description: An initial integrated programme of work will be produced which will clearly identify each beneficiary's contribution and delivery schedule required to deliver the WP4 work programme.

result.title: Review of transparency solutions for healthy, sustainable, and safe food systems in existing policy
result.description: A desk-based review of policy documents will be conducted to examine how visions for transparency align from policy, technological and organizational perspectives. Additionally this report will integrate the outcome of the 1st round of focus groups described in T7.2. A report will be produced at M9 to drive subsequent tasks of the project.

result.title: Requirements and cross-cutting challenges for digital transparency
result.description: This report will provide insight into the different requirements and cross-cutting challenges for the technologies creating transparency. Data will be gathered in the focus groups and during interviews. This data will then be systematically analysed to get insight into the context. The report will contain a BPMN model of the supply chains and interaction between their systems as well as an extensive description of context-dependent requirements and cross-cutting challenges in these supply chains.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - TITAN (Transparency solutions for transforming the food system.)
result.teaser: The European Green Deal is the central strategy of the European Union to transform European society with a modern, resource-efficient and competitive economy, while addressing climate and environmental challenges. The Farm to Fork strategy follows the path traced by the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Communication and Dissemination toolkit, containing Strategy Plan, Project branding and identity, website
result.description: Communication and dissemination toolkit, containing Communication and Dissemination Strategy Plan (CDSP), Project Branding, Visual Identity and Communication Supports: production of the project logo, supporting communication materials (PowerPoint , flyers, newsletter templates), website and social media tools. The project Website will include information about the project framework, description of the technology, events and contacts for public communications.

result.title: Plan for synergistic work of health pilots
result.description: An initial integrated programme of work will be produced which will clearly identify each partners contribution and delivery schedule required to deliver the WP6 work programme. If new devices are being developed, the report will, where relevant, report the progress of the system specifications, system development, sample preparation, system validation and results of the targeted samples.

result.title: "Development of the lexicon, trained panel validation and sensory profiling of new ready-to-eat plant-based ""meatballs"" in tomato sauce"

details.authors: Talens, Clara; Lago, Maider; Illanes, Eder; Baranda, Ana; Ibargüen, Mónica; Santa Cruz, Elena

result.title: TITAN Open Call Evaluation and Selection Report
result.description: Report with the information about submitted proposals, details about the evaluation procedure, details about the selection procedure, information about the selected proposals, members of the consortium, objectives, timelines, budget.

result.title: Plan for synergistic work of sustainability pilots
result.description: KPIs and their measurements’ method are defined in M6 to assess pilot progress on their results, modularity, flexibility and potential impact on food chain sustainability

result.title: State of the art of available semantic resources for supporting digital food chain
result.description: The report will describe the scope of the semantic resources needed for the food chain. The report will include the description of the evaluation of these resources and the criteria used, in particular on points such as their potential i) to formalize food chain concepts ii) to be aligned with other resources to constitute a coherent set for the food chain. In other words, their ability to link data from different user cases and these resources should allow actors to harmonize information exchanges and avoid ambiguities. The report will also describe what level of finesse the resources must have to be able to be adopted and taken in hand by users but also by software agents in order to efficiently support the digital food chain.

result.title: TITAN Open Call Guide
result.description: This deliverable comprises the information needed for the applicants to apply for the TITAN Open Call: including the Open Call text with objectives, scope and timeline of the Open Call as well as details on eligibility and evaluation criteria.

category.title: internet of things
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/internet/internet of things

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
